casebody.data:
(First Circuit—Hamilton Co., O., Circ’t Court Jan. Term, 1899.) Before Hale, Marvin and Caldwell, JJ.

[of the Eighth Circuit, sitting in the First Circuit.]

GEBAUR v. VESPER. Judgment of court in trial of case without jury equivalent to verdict of jury— See 41 W. L. B., 41. PER CURIAM.

A judgment by the court without the intervention of a jury is'„to be treated, on review as to weight of evidence, according to” the same rules that apply to a verdict by a jury — that is, the judgment cannot be reversed unless manifestly against the weight of the evidence.
